Career Profile

Experiences

Research Scientist & Analyst

2020 - Present
IBSS, Silver Spring, MD

Seeking to help change the way research is done. Adopting principles of open science (inclusion, fairness, sharing) to ensure reproducibility, transparency, collaboration, and accountability. At the heart of all my research interests lies ecosystem based fisheries management (EBFM), managing resources to reflect the relationships among all ecosystem components. I work in a collaborative environment to aid in the development of software (mostly in R) and to develop statistical approaches to further the goal of managing an ecosystem as a whole.

Scientific Programmer

2016 - 2020
Integrated Statistics, Woods Hole, MA

Coordinate, collaborate, and develop statistical modelling software for use in support of Ecosystem Based Fisheries Management objectives. Create publications for peer reviewed journals and center documents. Implement versioning, documentation, naming standards on products. Create software to enable standardized data retrieval from center databases. Lead workshops describing the use of tools used in open science principles (GitHub, R, markdown) to best collaborate with others in a transparent and reproducible manner. Summer student supervision.

Research Assistant -> Information Systems Associate

1996 - 2016
Woods Hole Oceanographic Institution, Woods Hole, MA

Statistical analysis, data analysis, model fitting, programming of scientific problems. Specifically; statistical analysis of ecological data, fitting ecological and statistical models, simulating from models, parameter estimation and hypothesis testing. Writing for scientific publications, providing statistical assistance/advice. Database management and quality control. Teach programming classes to undergraduate and postgraduate students with emphasis on the application of statistical models. Student supervision during summer months.

Troubleshooting PC and network related problems for department staff ranging from standard software issues to computer functionality, network configuration, security issues and purchase and installation of hardware and software.

Freelance Database designer

2001 - 2002
Lobster Conservancy, Friendship, ME

Designer and creator of the Lobster Conservancy’s database. A non-profit corporation dedicated to protecting and preserving the American lobster and the traditional trap fishery it supports. The database enables volunteers from an ongoing monitoring program to input field observations in a simple and efficient manner and enable the users to extract information for research purposes.

Web Designer/Photographer (Co-owner)

2002 - Present
Bello Photography, Mashpee, MA

Design and implementation of the business website and blog. From purchasing the domain names, listing with a registrar, hosting the sites, design, implement, test, and transfer content to servers. Languages used - PHP, HTML, CSS

Publications

I have been an author or coauthor of over 30 publications in a variety of journals such as Fisheries Oceanography, ICES Journal of Marine Science, Biology Letters, Journal of Water & Health, Progress in Oceanography, Limnology & Oceanography, Journal of Agricultural, Biological, and Environmental Statistics, Marine Ecology Progress Series, Frontiers in Marine Science, Journal of Applied Ecology plus many others. To learn more about these publications check out:

  • Zotero : A Bibliography of all publications with links to journals.
  • Google Scholar : List of publications (and citations to them) with accessible copies.
  • Research Gate : Professional network for scientists and researchers.

    • About me

    I enjoy the outdoors. From hiking, mountain biking, bird watching, walking my dog, to travel. Travel is a passion. I love seeing new places, experiencing new cultures, tasting new cuisine, and attempting to converse in other languages, although I am not fluent, or close to being, in any language. I enjoy playing sports especially soccer and golf. I have played on many teams through my life (1st Team – University Golf team, 1st Team – University Badminton team, O40’s Div. 2 Soccer Team). I am equally as happy playing board games with friends and family. I am an avid photographer, especially when I travel, and like to read.
